description: V-75389: The Ubuntu operating system must be a vendor supported release.
V-75391: Ubuntu vendor packaged system security patches and updates must be installed and up to date.
V-75393: The Ubuntu operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before access to the system.
V-75435: The Ubuntu operating system must display the Standard Mandatory DoD Notice and Consent Banner before access to the system.

description: V-75437: The Ubuntu operating system must enable a user session lock until that user re-establishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.
V-75439: All users must be able to directly initiate a session lock for all connection types.
V-75441: Ubuntu operating system sessions must be automatically logged out after 15 minutes of inactivity.
V-75443: The Ubuntu operating system must limit the number of concurrent sessions to ten for all accounts and/or account types.
V-75445: The Ubuntu operating system must prevent direct login into the root account.
V-75449: The Ubuntu operating system must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one upper-case character be used.
V-75451: The Ubuntu operating system must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one lower-case character be used.
V-75453: The Ubuntu operating system must enforce password complexity by requiring that at least one numeric character be used.
V-75455: All passwords must contain at least one special character.
V-75457: The Ubuntu operating system must require the change of at least 8 characters when passwords are changed.
V-75459: The Ubuntu operating system must encrypt all stored passwords with a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm.
V-75463: The Ubuntu operating system must employ FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithms for all created passwords.
V-75465: The pam_unix.so module must use a FIPS 140-2 approved cryptographic hashing algorithm for system authentication.
